medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presented with epigastric pain for 1 month, described as sharp/throbbing with radiation to the flanks and back. Pain waxes and wanes, worsens with oral intake, and is accompanied by some nausea and decreased oral intake. Constipation with small daily bowel movements reported. Denies nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, melena, bright red blood per rectum, dysuria, vaginal bleeding, or discharge. No chest pain, shortness of breath, or cough noted.
